result.execSummary:
All charges against John R Hauk Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John R Hauk Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R Hauk Jr

records.addlTxt: On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.
Defendant John R Hauk not in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($300.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court prior to case being called.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant John R Hauk in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for status conference.
Defense requests adjournment so defendant can obtain his driver's license.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John R Hauk not in court, defendant in custody in Ashland County Jail.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. Attorney Michael Plaisted is in jury trial in Branch 06 (Honorable Judge Brostrom) for today's proceedings.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for November 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John R Hauk in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Status conference held off the record.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense requests a Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 37.

Defendant John R Hauk in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the Milwaukee, County of.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John R Hauk in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-31-2015 at 1:30pm
